comments:
Driver:  RC4

In a new workspace, 
1. Istall Tomcat 5.0 server runtime.
2. Create a Web project targeting Tomcat 5.0.
3. Create a simple Java bean and go through creating a bottom-up Web service.
4. On the 1st page, deselect "Install Web service".  Click Next until the Bean Configuration Page.

Clicking Next on that page generates the WSDL file and the WSDD but would stay on the same page.  

Here are the console log with tracing enabled:

Kathy and I both bumped into this. It's an out-of-the-box bug and on the edge of the golden path, so I'd like to get it fixed in 1.0.1.

Created an attachment (id=32044)
apply to jst.ws.consumption.ui

changes to StartClientWidgetFactory to check context for install option when generating the client.

Created an attachment (id=32045)
apply to jst.ws.creation.ui

changes to StartServerWidgetFactory to check context for install option
Attachments contain fix.  Tested combined scenario plus client alone from URI.

Peter, please also take a look at this scenario from error handling point of view.  There's code put in recently to make sure that the status handler returns the proper message when the command reports an error.  It does not look like it's happening properly in this scenario.
Patch committed and released as v20060106_1232.

Fixes is contained in WTP 1.0.1 M build M200601102004:

http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/M-M200601102004-200601102004/
Verified on WTP 1.0.1 M build M200601102004.
